results.definition: a military operation (often involving new supplies of men and materiel) to strengthen a military force or aid in the performance of its mission
a device designed to provide additional strength
examples: he used gummed reinforcements to hold the page in his notebook

results.definition: information that makes more forcible or convincing
examples: his gestures provided eloquent reinforcement for his complaints

results.definition: an act performed to strengthen approved behavior
(psychology) a stimulus that strengthens or weakens the behavior that produced it
